items.text: length ball on off, and guided down to third man for a walking single

dropped catch! Length ball from around the wicket, and Tamim goes fishing. Tries to play a late cut, but very nearly hits it straight to the keeper's gloves. Just past his left, and runs away for four
items.shortText: Adair to Tamim Iqbal, FOUR runs

items.text: up and over! Fullish, wide outside off, and he gently lifts it over the off-side infielders
items.shortText: Adair to Tamim Iqbal, FOUR runs

items.text: length ball, wide outside off, and he runs this down to third man for one
items.postText: Arzoo: "@Abdul Bashet, You are spot on, its a real problem for Tiger batters not to rotate strike enough, take singles to keep the score moving even when bowlers keep bowling tight! Need to work on it, time is running out. Not ever team will not be IRE or WI in this world cup, it will come hard and fast to hunt you, if you are not prepared enough for these scenario."

items.text: back of a length on off, and clipped off his hips to square leg
items.postText: Vinod Rajpal: "How is the wicket playing Sreshth, are the runs coming very easy ??" -- no demons in the surface plus and short boundaries. Runs will always come easy

items.preText:
Sreekanth kadap: "This world cup is going to be nightmares for all the teams and superb entertainment for spectators...my 1st comment in ESPN....hope they publish "
And here's Josh Little. Left-arm pacer
items.text: full, on off, and driven away from his body to cover
items.shortText: Little to Liton Das, no run

items.text: length ball, outside off and angling away. Tries to cut, but mistimes to point
items.shortText: Little to Liton Das, no run

items.text: length ball angling away, and Liton tries to slap a cut, but the ball stays low and goes through to the keeper on the bounce
items.shortText: Little to Liton Das, no run

items.text: short on off, but not fast enough to trouble an international batsman. Rides the bounce and cuts it over point for four
items.postText: Samin: "Here in Bangladesh, most people I know are happy that Ireland scored almost 300. Has been a wakeup call for a better death bowling, and some real chasing practice (at last)"
items.shortText: Little to Liton Das, FOUR runs

items.text: length ball, outside off, and cut away to point
items.shortText: Little to Liton Das, no run

items.text: chipped but lands safely. Offcutter outside off, and Liton is through his shot too early. Flies off the bat's edge, but nobody's there at short third man
items.postText: Shahed: "How is Tamim not in IPL? I keep asking myself." -- equally shocking.

items.text: length ball, just outside off, and chopped down to third man
items.postText: Mahesh: "@Sreekanth, nightmares not for the teams, just their bowlers and captains. I'm sure the batsman are already having pleasant dreams of the pitches they're likely to encounter"

items.text: length ball, just outside off, and angling away. Shoulders his arms
items.shortText: Rankin to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: back of a length on leg, and he tiptoes to flick to square leg
items.postText: Fariha Nowshin : "@Sreekanth kadap...Dude, welcome to the frustrating world of non-publishing comments in ESPN CRICINFO. Be regular and you will feel the frustration of seeing your comments not being published matches after matches."

items.text: too wide and punished by Liton. Width offered and cut square past the infield
items.shortText: Rankin to Liton Das, FOUR runs

items.text: full, on off, and blocked off the front foot
items.postText: Shahed: "So far this is the best batting temperament/approach shown by Bangladesh batsmen in a series...some consistency at last...need to carry that to the world cup."
items.shortText: Rankin to Liton Das, no run

items.text: length ball angling in, and flicked off his hips to deep midwicket

items.preText: Vinod Rajpal: "@Mahesh & @Sreekanth ; I can even bet for Virat Kohli being the top Run scorer for the World Cup with minimum 3-4 Centuries !!" -- Interesting. I think it will be an opening batsman. Warner, Bairstow my pick
items.text: full on leg, and angling further down. Tamim misses the flick, but still collects the free run
back of a length on middle, and worked off his waist to deep midwicket. Enough time to jog back for the second

items.postText: ferdous06: "@Fariha, you are right. I think they have blacklisted a lot of spectators. I hope they prove me wrong." -- What? We would never. Hope you're happy to be proven wrong!

items.text: back of a length on middle, and going over Tamim's head. Half-ducks under the ball
items.shortText: Little to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: KARIM: "Am I the onlyone who is thinking these two will finish the run chase by them self?" -- will end up breaking many records if that happens!
items.text: waited for the short ball, and this time he smacks this leg-side. Dockrell's in the deep, but the ball has gone through his fingers. D'oh!
items.shortText: Little to Tamim Iqbal, FOUR runs

items.text: length ball on off, and gently nudged to midwicket
gentle dab into the off side for a quick single
